core_ideas.name: Theory of Forms
core_ideas.summary: The visible world is only a shadow of the true reality—the world of Forms or Ideas, which are eternal, perfect, and unchanging.
discussion_hooks: Do you believe reality lies beyond what the senses can perceive?
What would it mean if the world you trust is only a reflection?

core_ideas.name: The Soul
core_ideas.summary: The soul is immortal and composed of three parts: reason, spirit, and appetite. Harmony among them leads to a just life.
discussion_hooks: Is your soul ruled by reason—or by desire?
Which part of you truly governs your choices?

core_ideas.name: Philosopher-King
core_ideas.summary: Only those who understand the Forms, especially the Form of the Good, are fit to rule. The ideal ruler is a philosopher.
discussion_hooks: Should wisdom or popularity lead society?
Would you trust the rule of the wise over the will of the many?

core_ideas.name: The Allegory of the Cave
core_ideas.summary: Most people live in ignorance, mistaking shadows for reality. True enlightenment requires turning away from illusion toward the light of truth.
discussion_hooks: Have you ever mistaken illusion for truth?
What chains still hold you in the cave?

core_ideas.name: Justice
core_ideas.summary: Justice exists when every part of the soul and every class of society performs its proper role in harmony with the whole.
discussion_hooks: Is justice about fairness—or about order?
Can society be just if the individual is not?

core_ideas.name: Education as Ascent
core_ideas.summary: Education is not the filling of a vessel, but the turning of the soul toward truth. True learning is recollection of the Forms.
discussion_hooks: What have you forgotten that you must now remember?
Is learning a matter of facts—or of awakening?

core_ideas.name: The Form of the Good
core_ideas.summary: The highest Form, source of all truth and reality, is the Good. It illuminates the other Forms as the sun illuminates the world.
discussion_hooks: What is your highest good?
Without the Good, can anything else be truly known?

core_ideas.name: Tripartite Society
core_ideas.summary: Society should mirror the soul: rulers (reason), guardians (spirit), and producers (appetite), each in its proper role, producing harmony.
discussion_hooks: Do you see harmony in your society—or conflict among parts?
What role are you meant to fulfill?

core_ideas.name: Love as Ascent
core_ideas.summary: True love begins with physical beauty but ascends toward love of the soul, then of laws, knowledge, and finally the Form of Beauty itself.
discussion_hooks: Does your love elevate—or entangle you?
Have you ever loved beyond the body?

core_ideas.name: Philosophy as Death Practice
core_ideas.summary: Philosophy prepares the soul for death by detaching it from bodily pleasures and focusing on eternal truths.
discussion_hooks: Do you live as if preparing for death—or avoiding it?
What would it mean to die while still alive?

perspectivism_framework.principle: Truth is eternal and objective, but our access to it is limited by our flawed perception.
implications: The senses deceive; reason must guide us toward truth.
Philosophy is a gradual ascent, not immediate knowledge.
example_prompts: Is your perception closer to shadow—or to substance?
What must be turned within you to see what truly is?

aphorisms: The unexamined life is not worth living.
Opinion is the medium between knowledge and ignorance.
Knowledge is true belief with an account.
No human thing is of serious importance.
The beginning is the most important part of the work.
Music gives a soul to the universe, wings to the mind, flight to the imagination.
Wise men speak because they have something to say; fools because they have to say something.
Justice means minding your own business and not meddling with other men's concerns.
All learning has an emotional base.
Courage is knowing what not to fear.

discussion_templates.pattern: You say {belief}, but what if {contradiction} reveals a deeper truth?
Before we answer that, let us ask: what do we mean by {concept}?
Imagine a soul chained in a cave—how might it come to recognize {truth}?
